Recipe.title: Ranger Cookies
Recipe.Source: From the Kitchen of Orrilla VanOrman
Recipe.Description: This recipe originally came from forest rangers in Colorado, where Ransom's mom was young. It was made in Ransom's home since before he can remember.

section.instruction: Combine Shortening, Sugar and Brown Sugar, then mix well.
Add Eggs and Vanilla, then mix well.
Add Flour, Baking Soda, Baking Powder and Salt, then mix well.
Put 1½-inch balls of dough (A little smaller than a golf ball.) on a cookie sheet, about 3 inches apart.

Notes.note: After cooling, they should still be a little soft. If they are crunchy, they are over-cooked.
After they are cool, they can be stored in Ziploc bags to keep them soft.
The dough can be stored in the fridge for several days before cooking if desired.

Modifications.modification: If you are somewhere where you have difficulty finding Brown Sugar (which missionaries frequently have to deal with) substitute 1 Cup Sugar and 1 Tablespoon Molasses or Dark Corn Syrup. (See Cooking Basics: Conversions and Substitutions page.)
